Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> ok so with your first analogy. What was unique about it compared to leaving the room and catching up later?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> so like I was saying, 1 of the 3 guys leaves the room while the other 2 keep making transactions in their ledgers, the 3rd guy let's say doesn't add anything to his ledger, when he returns he just updates with the entries the other 2 made and is caught up

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> yeah i understand that. So that is when you turn off you wallet and not change it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> What's unique about the other analogy, wherein the 3rd guy "forks" away, that's equivelent to him leaving the room and while he's alone entering transaction entries that the 2 don't know about

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> So, how does being on a different wallet mean that you are making transactions that the other two dont know about?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> then he comes back and wants them to be valid, but in those lines where he entered his own, unbeknownst to the other 2, they have agreed upon transactions already filling it out.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> So they aren't going to delete theirs in favor of his

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> if he wants to keep entering valid data with them, he has to delete all the entries he made alone and replace them with thiers

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> why do old wallets make up their own transactions?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> i get that more ledgers wins. I don;t get that an old wallet tries to make transactions that other ledgers don't know about

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> So that's a really simplified, to make the "fork" part more understandable let's say there are 10 people and 3 leave

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> the 3 sit in another room making entries in their ledgers

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> go on

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <papacheal> @John Westbrook Has anyone else mentioned the UI "bug" that seems to have appeared in 5.5 wallet release regarding staking/mining? When I click "Start Staking", the  UI appears to enable both Staking and Mining as "true", as if they are linked. If I "Stop Mining" nothing happens; I have to "Stop Staking" to stop them both.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> then 1 of those 3 tries to go back to the other 7 and have his new entries validated and the 7 to replace their entires with his new ones from the group of 3

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> not going to happen because the 7 already had consensus on their entries made while he was away

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> @papacheal check out gui channel buddy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> so if he wants to keep a valid book within that group of 7, he would need to remove the entries the 3 made and update that section of where he was away with entries from the 7

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <papacheal> @GlorymanRTS My bad...didn't scroll back far enough past your accounting discussion. üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> Now, add one more layer

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> @John Westbrook yeah bro I understand more ledgers with the same entries is a different fork from other ledgers with a different entries.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> they aren't just entering data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> @papacheal np buddy. I hope it solved your problem

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> ok i get that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> everyone agrees to keep a duplicate ledger of all transactions that occur in the group in order

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> listening to the extra layer part now

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> yeah i get that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> now the 3 leave the room

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> 5 plus 5 plus 5 right

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> in a different room they exchange tokens

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> the 3

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> they make record of it in the same ledgers they took with them from the first room

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> let's say, for simplification, while the 3 are away 3 thransactions are made by them in their little room.  and by luck 3 transactions are made in the group of 7.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <stretcher83> Just following along , nice explanation john üëçüèº

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> so they get an eraser and say dont worry you can be on the same group of leaders (JK) üòÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> if any one or all of the 3 return to the first room, their copies of ledgers will only match each other (the 3), but not the 7

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> the 7 say, if you want to stay and enter in your book the rule is that everyone's ledger must match before we move on to the next entry

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> So they either need stay out of the room or erase the 3 transaction entries they made while away and replace them with the 3 made by the 7 during that time, then they can join the group again and keep going

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> That's why we have words like consensus or rules etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> or even algorithm

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> So person A 5 to person B, Person B 5 to Person C, in the group of 3. if the 7 show Person B 5 to Person C. It wont count because they didn't have the first transaction person A5 to person B, right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> but they could delete the A5 to person B and they will be let back in

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> So it all matches?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> except that in the room of 7 they won't know about the transaction of Person B to Person C, because it occurred in the other room.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> So they'd have to delete any and all entries made while away from the room of 7

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> if no entries were made, (they were offline), then it's a moot point

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> they just have to add the entries they missed while away

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> maybe they had to use the restroom

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> no harm done
